alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Delta; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Luce; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 4:33AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Significant Winter Storm Brings Heavy Wet Snow to Upper Michigan late Sunday into early Tuesday... A low pressure develops over Lake Huron Sunday night and stays nearly stationary through Tuesday morning. Strong northerly winds behind the cold front bring colder temperatures that changes precipitation to accumulating wet snow across higher elevations of west-central Upper Michigan Sunday night. Locally heavy snow continues across higher elevations of Baraga and Marquette Counties on Monday before shifting into the eastern U.P. by Tuesday morning. Snowfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches are expected across higher elevations of west-central Upper Michigan. Locally higher amounts exceeding 12 inches are possible across the Michigamme Highlands of eastern Baraga and western Marquette Counties. Heavy wet snow combined with frequent northerly gusts up to 40 mph may lead to power outages and tree damage. Sloppy accumulations up to 4 inches at lower elevations combined with more lingering fall foliage could lead to sporadic power outages and tree damage. Persons planning travel through Upper Michigan late Sunday into Tuesday morning should monitor the latest updated forecasts and statements from the Marquette National Weather Service and local media on this potentially significant early-season winter weather event.
